p.s: The given text Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't, written by John Worne and published in the The Telegraph on January 2015, addresses the importance of the English language in relation to the UK.
The author feels that language learning in school has decreased significantly and fewer people are ready to learn new languages.
Right at the beginning the author says that people are not interested in learning foreign languages.
He says the number of people learning foreign languages at university level has declined in recent years.
He also mentions that over ten thousand fewer foreign language exams were passed than at the end of 1990.
Worne criticizes this in the following.
He also says that no technology can replace the acquisition of a language because it is essential for the future.
He brings up the point of globalization and comes back to the importance of language.
According to him, things like trade between countries or the national security can only run smoothly if you have the language and can communicate with one otherone another.
What he also sees critically is that only a few take advantage of the offer to learn a foreign language at university.
In his opinion, a lot more people have to do that because the possibilities are there just not the desire.
